title: Derivative Equation
text: The derivative of the function f(x) at a is defined by /lim{x,a}(f(x)-f(a))/(x-a).
speech: The derivative of the function f(x) at a is defined by /lim{x,a}(f(x)-f(a))/(x-a).
pacedSpeech: The derivative of the function f(x) at a is defined by /lim{x,a}(f(x)-f(a))/(x-a).

title: Plugging In
text: Plug $$2$$ into a and expand the equation.
speech: Plug  2  into a and expand the equation.
pacedSpeech: into a and expand the equation.

title: Simplify
speech: Simplify the resulting equation:  fraction, x squared plus 9 x minus 2 squared plus 9 times 2, over, x minus 2,
